user Package¶

userModel Module¶

fla.gr user model

Given a userID or a username or a email, return the users couchdb ORM

http://xkcd.com/353/

Josh Ashby 2013 http://joshashby.com joshuaashby@joshashby.com

>>> import models.user.userModel as um
>>> import bcrypt
class models.user.userModel.userORM(id=None, **values)¶

Bases: couchdb.mapping.Document, models.baseModel.baseCouchModel

Base ORM for users in fla.gr, this one currently uses couchdb to store the data. TODO: Flesh this doc out a lot more

clearAlerts()¶

Clears the current users expired alerts.

getAlerts()¶

Returns a str on compiled alerts, for direct placement in a template

Returns:Str of alerts
classmethod login(user, password, cookieID)¶

Attempt to find and then log in a user, if their passwords match

Parameters:
  • user – The userID or username of the user to log in
  • password – The plain text password which the user supplies, to be checked against the found password
Returns:

The userORM instance if a user if found and the passwords match. Raises an exception if the password, or username are wrong, or if the user has been disabled.
loginThis(cookieID)¶

Kind of like above, however this one logs in a user. No password checking or usernames to find, just pass the cookieID and they’re set. For example: when finishing registering, the user can be logged in without having to go through the log in process...

Parameters:cookieID – The sessions cookie ID for the person to login
logout()¶

Sets the users loggedIn to False then removes the link between their session and their userORM

classmethod new(username, password)¶

Make a new user, checking for username conflicts. If no conflicts are found the password is encrypted with bcrypt and the resulting userORM returned.

>>> password = "test"
>>> username = "Test"
>>> newUser = um.userORM.new(username, password)
>>> newUser 
<userORM ...>
>>> assert newUser.password == bcrypt.hashpw(password, newUser.password)
>>> assert newUser.username == username
Parameters:
  • username – The username that should be used for the new user
  • password – The plain text password that should be used for the password.
Returns:

userORM if the username is available
pushAlert(message, quip='', alertType='info', expire='next')¶

Creates an alert message to be displayed or relayed to the user, This is a higher level one for use in HTML templates. All params are of type str

Parameters:
  • message – The text to be placed into the main body of the alert
  • quip – Similar to a title, however just a quick attention getter
  • alertType – Can be any of success error info warning
  • expire – Currently this isn’t used, however it can be set to anything other than next to have the alert stay permanently
save()¶

Override of the baseCouchModel method: save Saves the user object, along with saving the alerts to redis

saveAlerts()¶

Saves the current users alerts and places them into redis

setPassword(password)¶

Sets the users password to password

Parameters:password – plain text password to hash
